inject: Breaking: Adversary media claims a NATO vehicle struck a civilian car. Graphic (but fabricated) photos are circulating rapidly.

filter.intro: Final test. Maximum threat. Less than one hour active, massive bot push, graphic images. Adversary going for knockout blow. Speed is everything now.
filter.outro: This is why we train. Fact-checking works IF you move fast - dashcam footage, GPS logs, timestamps destroy the lie. Pre-bunking saves you here - if audiences already skeptical of fake accident claims, they wait for verification. Counter-narrative risky - seems like changing subject when 'people died.' Discrediting also risky - looks defensive when emotions high. Ignoring? Catastrophic. Photos 'prove' guilt, silence confirms it.

metadata.teachingPoint: Crisis response requires speed, evidence, and prior audience preparation
